meanings.definition: A hard-shelled clam found along the Atlantic coast of North America.
meanings.sent1: The quahog was nestled in the sand.
meanings.sent2: We collected quahogs at the beach for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The seagull tried to crack open the quahog with its beak.
meanings.sent4: The quahog's shell was as tough as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The children marveled at the quahog's intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: The edible flesh of this clam.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious quahog dish.
meanings.sent2: The quahog meat was tender and flavorful.
meanings.sent3: I savored the taste of the quahog in my pasta.
meanings.sent4: The quahog's meat was like a savory surprise.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cooked quahog filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A type of clam chowder made with quahogs.
meanings.sent1: The quahog chowder warmed us on a cold day.
meanings.sent2: Grandma's quahog chowder recipe was a family favorite.
meanings.sent3: The quahog chowder bubbled on the stove, tempting us.
meanings.sent4: The quahog chowder was a creamy delight.
meanings.sent5: The rich flavor of the quahog chowder lingered on my taste buds.
